meta.name: description
meta.content: Wilson County Schools is home to passionate teachers who love, encourage and challenge their students. Check out these videos and the ones below of our school-level Teachers of the Year sharing why they teach!

li.a: Meals for Students - Comidas Disponibles Para Ninos
Conversations with Children - Conversaciones con Ninos

header.h2: Message to Families and Staff - April 24, 2020

div.p:
As many of you are aware, Governor Cooper announced today that students will not be returning to school buildings this year, but will continue with at-home learning until our last day of school...click Read full story.
Como muchos de ustedes saben, el Gobernador Cooper anunció hoy que los estudiantes no regresarán a los edificios escolares este año, sino que continuarán con el aprendizaje en el hogar hasta nuestro último día de clases...haga clic para leer la historia completa.

img.alt: picture of WECA students with backpacks

section.class: content-container news2-container slick-container content-size-small orientation-horizontal thumbnail-coverage-full

h3.a: Message to Families and Staff - April 24, 2020

div.div:
As many of you are aware, Governor Cooper announced today that students will not be returning to school buildings this year, but will continue with at-home learning until our last day of school...click Read full story.
Como muchos de ustedes saben, el Gobernador Cooper anunció hoy que los estudiantes no regresarán a los edificios escolares este año, sino que continuarán con el aprendizaje en el hogar hasta nuestro último día de clases...haga clic para leer la historia completa.
April. 24, 2020 Shout Out! to Wilson Academy of Applied Technology Principal Krystal Cox for the way she is recognizing students every week who are excelling in their choice board assignments!
April. 24, 2020 Shout Out! to students at Vinson-Bynum ES who are engaged in their remote learning! Our school buildings might be closed, but school is still in session.
April. 23, 2020 Shout Out! to the amazing young ladies who were a part of our very first lacrosse teams at Beddingfield HS, Fike HS and Hunt HS!
April. 23, 2020 The WCS website - wilsonschoolsnc.net - features a COVID-19 tab filled with information and resources.
April. 22, 2020 Shout Out! to the Beddingfield HS Firefighter 2 students for completing their State Practical in early March with the assistance of the Black Creek Volunteer Fire Department.
April. 22, 2020 Happy Earth Day! Shout Out! to New Hope ES Second-Grade Teacher Meagan Moss for working with students on a life cycle activity to celebrate this special day.
April. 22, 2020 Happy Administrative Professionals Day to the incredible secretaries, administrative assistants, receptionists and other office professionals who work in our schools and departments!

h3.a: Message for Families and Staff - April 17

div.div: This message is regarding the next round of instructional materials, updates to our food sites and information about school reassignment for next year...

In keeping with public health guidance, the April 20 Board of Education meeting will be conducted virtually. The public and news media may view the meeting live by watching WCS-TV Channel 22 on Time Warner Cable and Greenlight. Any person who desires to address the Board should email comments to publiccomments@wilsonschoolsnc.net by noon on the day of the meeting.

div.span: 117 NE Tarboro St., PO Box 2048, Wilson, NC 27894

div.div: Wilson County Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, marital or parental status, in admission, to access, to treatment in its programs and activities. This website endeavors to comply with best practices and standards defined by Section 508 of the U.S. Rehabilitation Act. If you are having accessibility concerns, please contact us at 252-399-7712.
